Swift: UIView Animation 2

Sunday, March 29, 2015

Overview

This is part 2 of the animations post. In this post, we will look at how to add special animations to views. Like when you slide from the bottom of an iPhone and the menu appears with a small bounce.

Content

Create a UIDynamicAnimator

1 var animator = UIDynamicAnimator(referenceView: UIView)

Add UIDynamicBehaviors to it (gravity, collisions etc.)

1 let gravity = UIGravityBehavior()
2 animator.addBehavior(gravity)
3 let collider = UICollisionBehavior()
4 animator.addBehavior(collider)

Add UIDynamicItems (usually UIViews) to the UIDynamicBehaviors.

1 let item1: UIDynamicItem = ... // usually a UIView
2 let item2: UIDynamicItem = ... // usually a UIView
3 
4 gravity.addItem(item1)
5 collider.addItem(item1)
6 gravity.addItem(item2)

UIDynamicItem

The UIDynamicItem protocol looks like this. UIView implements this protocol and if you change center or transform while the animator is running, you must call this method in UIDynamicAnimator: func updateItemUsingCurrentState(item: DynamicItem)`

1 protocol UIDynamicItem {
2     var bounds: CGRect { get }
3     var center: CGPoint { get set }
4     var transform: CGAffineTransform { get set }
5 }

UIGravityBehavior

1 var angle: CGFloat      // in radians; 0 is to the right; positive numbers are counter-clockwise
2 var magniture: CGFloat  // 1.0 is 1000 points/s/s

UIAttachmentBehavior

1 init(item: UIDynamicItem, attachedToAnchor: CGPoint)
2 init(item: UIDynamicItem, attachedToItem: UIDynamicItem)
3 init(item: UIDynamicItem, offsetFromCenter: CGPoint, attachedToItem/Anchor...)
4 var length: CGFloat
5 var anchorPoint: CGPoint

UICollisionBehavior

1 var collisionMode: UICollisionBehaviorMode // .Items, .Boundaries, .Everything
2 // with .Items, any items you add to a UICollisionBehavior will bounce off of each other
3 // with .Boundaries, then you add UIBezierPath boundaries for items to bounce off of
4 
5 func addBoundaryWithIdentifier(identifier: NSCopying, forPath: UIBezierPath)
6 func removeBoundaryWithIdentifier(identifier: NSCopying)
7 var translatesReferenceBoundsIntoBoundary: Bool // referencesView's edges

Example

 1 class DropItBehavior: UIDynamicBehavior {
 2     let gravity = UIGravityBehavior()
 3     lazy var collider: UICollisionBehavior {
 4        let lazyCollider = UICollisionBehavior() 
 5        lazyCollider.translateReferenceBoundsIntoBoundary = true
 6        return lazyCollider
 7     }()
 8     lazy var dropBehavior: UIDynamicItemBehavior = {
 9         let lazyDrop = UIDynamicItemBehavior()
10         lazyDrop.allowsRotation = false
11         lazyDrop.elasticity = 0.75
12         return lazyDrop
13     }()
14     
15     override init() {
16         super.init()
17         addChildBehavior(gravity)
18         addChildBehavior(collider)
19         addChildBehavior(dropBehavior)
20     }
21     
22     func addDrop(drop: UIView) {
23         dynamicAnimator?.referenceView?.addSubview(drop)
24         gravity.addItem(drop)
25         collider.addItem(drop)
26         dropBehavior.addItem(drop)
27     }
28     
29     func removeDrop(drop: UIView) {
30         gravity.removeItem(drop)
31         collider.removeItem(drop)
32         dropBehavior.removeItem(drop)
33         drop.removeFromSuperview()
34     }
35 }
 1 class DropBlockViewController: UIViewController {
 2     @IBOutlet weak var gameView: UIView!
 3     var dropsPerRow = 10
 4     var dropSize: CGSize {
 5         let size = gameView.bounds.size.width / CGFloat(dropsPerRow)
 6         return CGSize(width:size, height:size)
 7     }
 8     
 9     let dropBehavior = DropItBehavior()
10     
11     lazy var animator: UIDynamicAnimator = {
12         // set to gameView in viewDidLoad because it has to set Outlet
13         return UIDynamicAnimator(referenceView: self.gameView)
14     }()
15     
16     @IBAction func drop(sender: UITapGestureRecognizer) {
17         drop()
18     }
19     
20     override func viewDidLoad() {
21         super.viewDidLoad()
22         animator.addBehavior(dropBehavior)
23     }
24     
25     func drop() {
26         var frame = CGRect(origin: CGPointZero, size:dropSize)
27         frame.origin.x = CGFloat.random(dropsPerRow) * dropSize.width
28         
29         let dropView = UIView(frame:frame)
30         dropView.backgroundColor = UIColor.random
31         
32         dropBehavior.addDrop(dropView)
33     }
34 }
35 
36 private extension CGFloat {
37     static func random(max: Int) -> CGFloat {
38         return CGfloat(arc4random() % UInt32(max))
39     }
40 }
